description.plain:
Lady Antebellum is an American country pop music group formed in Nashville, Tennessee in 2006.

The trio is composed of:
Hillary Scott (lead and background vocals)
Charles Kelley (lead and background vocals)
Dave Haywood (background vocals, guitar, piano, mandolin)

description.plain: “Need You Now” is the title track, first track and first single of Lady Antebellum’s second studio album. The song was a massive crossover hit, netting the country trio a #2 Hot 100 hit and their second #1 Hot Country hit. Additionally, the song earned four Grammys at the 2011 ceremonies including Song and Record of the Year.

description.plain:
This is about Hillary Scott and drummer Chris Tyrell’s good night kiss when they started dating each other.

Hillary Scott said: “We love writing songs from personal experience, and this is definitely one of those songs. There is so much excitement at the beginning of a new relationship … all the butterflies and that optimistic feeling that this person could be ‘the one.’”

They don’t want to ruin this relationship by going too fast. Just a good night kiss is enough as a beautiful start to a life long love story. What is the point of rushing ‘cause if he/she is the one, you will have all the rest of your life with that person, right?

Hell yeah, they are married now!

description.plain: “Bartender” is a song by Lady Antebellum, written by group members Dave Haywood, Charles Kelley, and Hillary Scott along with Rodney Clawson, and co-produced with Nathan Chapman. The song was released on May 19, 2014 as as the lead single from the group’s sixth studio album, 747.  The song deal with a woman’s heartbreak, and her way of getting over it.

description.plain:
“I Run to You” is a song by Lady Antebellum, which was was released in January 2009 as the third and final single from the group’s self-titled debut album. The song became Lady Antebellum’s first number one single, reaching that peak in July of 2009.

The song became even more successful when it won the Grammy Award for Best Country Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocals in 2009.

Lyrically, the song is sung by two narrators, Hillary Scott and Charles Kelly, who express to each other that they will always be there for one another, no matter the circumstance.

We run on fumes

Like the sands of time

[Pre-Chorus: Both]

[Chorus: Both]
This world keeps spinning faster
Into a new disaster, so I run to you
I run to you, baby
And when it all starts comin' undone
Baby, you're the only one I run to
I run to you

[Bridge: Charles, Hillary]
Whoa, whoa
Oh, I run to you

[Chorus: Both]
This world keeps spinning faster
Into a new disaster, so I run to you
I run to you, baby
And when it all starts comin' undone
Baby, you're the only one I run to

[Break: Charles, Hillary and Both ]
I run to you, I run to you, yeah
Whoa, whoa
Oh, I run to you
I run to you, girl
Whoa, whoa, mmm

[Outro]
I always run to you
Run to you
Run to you

description.plain: “American Honey” is a song recorded by American country music group Lady Antebellum. It was released on January 11, 2010, as the second single from their sophomore album, Need You Now. The song reached #25 on the Billboard Hot 100 and #1 on the Billboard country chart.

description.plain:
“Famous” is the 12th track off of Lady Antebellum’s album, Heart Break.

Lyrically, the song deals with downside of being a famous celebrity in a world where many celebrities are scrutinized for the things that they do. The song also deals with how often gossip magazines will sometimes tend report on stories that often show a celebrity in a “negative light”. The negative light often refers to if a celebrity goes to rehab, how unflattering they might look, or things that are possible going on in their personal life.

description.plain:
“Our Kind of Love” is a song recorded by Lady Antebellum. Written by the all three members of the group with busbee, it was released in May 2010 as the third single from their album, Need You Now.

The song peaked at #51 on the Billboard Hot 100 and #1 on the Billboard US Country Songs Chart.

description.plain:
“Love Don’t Live Here” is a song by American Lady Antebellum, released as the first single from their self titled debut album in October of 2007.

Lyrically, the song is about a man who is unwilling to rekindle the relationship he and his significant other once had.

body.plain:
“Love Don’t Live Here” is a song by American Lady Antebellum, released as the first single from their self titled debut album in October of 2007.

Lyrically, the song is about a man who is unwilling to rekindle the relationship he and his significant other once had.

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1]

It might take some time to get back what is gone
But I'm moving on and you don't haunt my dreams
Like you did before
Oh, when I would curse your name
Hey!
Well I heard the news that you were back in town
Just passing through to claim your lost and found
But I'm over you and there ain't nothing there
That you could say or do to take what you did back

[Pre-Chorus]

And think what's mine is yours again

[Chorus]

Forgetting all the love we once knew

But I ain't got a heart for breaking
So go and pick your bags up off my floor
Oh, 'cause love don't live here anymore
Oh no

[Verse 2]

But honey, I'm no fool

Too many times with you

[Pre-Chorus]

Is you can lay in the bed you've made

[Chorus]
'Cause I've been doing fine without you
Forgetting all the love we once knew
And girl, I ain't the one who slammed that door
Oh, should've known
Now you say you've changed your thinking
But I ain't got a heart for breaking
So go and pick your bags up off my floor
Oh, 'cause love don't live here anymore

[Bridge]
Oh no
That love don't live here anymore

[Outro]
Oh no, no
Sugar no, no
And you don't live here anymore
And love don't live here anymore
And since you walked out of my door
Love don't live here
Love don't live here, girl
Oh, love don't live here anymore

description.plain: “As You Turn Away” is about a relationship between two people; one is trying to save the relationship by doing all she can, and the other has already given up and doesn’t want it anymore. She has put everything into saving their relationship, to the point where she has nothing left to give anymore, with the only option being to walk away regardless of how much pain it will cause.

description.plain:
“It Ain’t Pretty” shows the reflection of love’s challenges, whilst mending a broken heart. It also shows how far some people will go to forget about the pain of their heartbreak, like going out and getting drunk, or kissing a total stranger.

“It Ain’t Pretty” was one of six songs featured on Lady Antebellum’s fifth album Golden, that wasn’t written by them.

songs.lyrics:

It ain't pretty, it ain't pretty
It ain't pretty
When a heart breaks

[Outro]
I just bought a drink, it ain't pretty
I just kissed a boy, it ain't pretty
I just called a cab

description.plain:
“And the Radio Played” is the fourteenth track on Lady Antebellum’s album, Golden.

The song references several country songs that have become hits over the past several decades. Lady Antebellum pays homage to all those hits by referencing them in the song.

In each one of the choruses, song from that certain era are references to specific years:

Chorus 1: 1980’s
Chorus 2: 1990’s
Chorus 3: 2000’s

body.plain:
“And the Radio Played” is the fourteenth track on Lady Antebellum’s album, Golden.

The song references several country songs that have become hits over the past several decades. Lady Antebellum pays homage to all those hits by referencing them in the song.

In each one of the choruses, song from that certain era are references to specific years:

Chorus 1: 1980’s
Chorus 2: 1990’s
Chorus 3: 2000’s

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
I remember riding shotgun in daddy's Chevrolet
We'd crank up The Pioneers, and we'd sing away
Sometimes he let me take the wheel and we'd drive through town
Couldn't wait to hear my favorite songs coming back around (Back around)

[Chorus]
And the radio played, Old Flame, I'll Still Be Loving you
I Was Country When Country Wasn't Cool, Forever and Ever Amen
Always On My mind again and again
Swinging and Smoky Mountain Rain
He Stopped Loving Her Today
We laughed, we cried the 80's away
And the radio played...

[Verse 2]
Bobby was the first boy that I ever kissed
I can still taste the root beer on his lips
We'd turn up the stereo from that bedroom
Climb through the window and make out on the roof

[Chorus 2]
And the radio played, Don't Rock the Jukebox and the Dance
Strawberry Wine and Brand New Man, Love Without End, Amen
Time Marches on, again and again, Meet in the Middle and Amazed
Does He Love You?, Independence Day
We laughed we cried the 90's away
And the radio played...

[Post-Chorus]
I was (Raised on the radio)
Raised on the radio
Raised on the radio
And the radio played
I was (Raised on the radio)
Raised on the radio
Raised on the radio

[Bridge]
And I hear 'em now
I'm right back in that place
And 20 years from now
I'll look back on today

[Chorus 3]
When the radio played I Hope You'll Dance, You'll Think of Me
What Hurts the Most, Before He Cheats
I Don't Want this Night to End
The House that Built Me, Remember When
Love Story, She's My Kind of Rain
She's Country, Forever and for Always
Don't Blink, I Saw God Today
And the radio plays..

[Post-Chorus]
I was (Raised on the radio)
Raised on the radio
Raised on the radio
And the radio played
I was (Raised on the radio)
Raised on the radio
Raised on the radio

[Outro]
Weren't you (Raised on the radio)
Raised on the radio
Raised on the radio
I was (Raised on the radio)
Raised on the radio
Raised on the radio

songs.lyrics:

Are they just things that people say?
